summary:
Technical Skills
8+ years of experience in manual testing in UNIX and Windows based OS domain in Casino Gaming Industry, Currently working as Lead Software Quality Assurance Engineer with Scientific Games Corporation. 
•	Strong knowledge of Software Testing Life Cycle.
•	Good at understanding the requirements and translating business processes into clear and comprehensive test scenarios and test cases. 
•	Expertise in testing web app and android app.
•	Created Test Plans for every project and executed the test cases in TestRail, Silk Central, Quality Center and QTest. 
•	Proficient experience in Functional Testing, Integration Testing, Regression Testing , Ad-hoc Testing, Black Box Testing and Smoke Testing.
•	Good hands-on experience in Bug Tracking Tools like Test Track Pro and JIRA. 
•	Ability to quickly learn applications flow.

Additional Skills
•	Good knowledge of Python scripting language and Selenium automation tool
•	Basic knowledge of C++ Programming
•	Basic knowledge of Database and SQL
•	Basic knowledge of API testing through Postman

awards.title: Spot Bonus for Take 'n Play project.
Star of the week
awards.description: Awarded star of the week several times for timely delivery of the project with efficient and quality work.

projects.title: New South Wales (Australia) [NSW]
projects.description:
Project Title	: NSW  
Client		: New South Wales (Australia).
Software used	: C, Linux, Windows.
Role		: Test Engineer.

Project Description: New South Wales Gaming Machine Communications Protocol is the serial based protocol which is used in NSW casino market jurisdiction. It has capabilities of handling external and internal progressive jackpots. Different ports are used to communicate with the dedicated devices, server and databases. 

Roles and Responsibilities:
•	Executed Test cases for Sanity, Functional and Regression. 
•	Involved in Scrum and Sprint Plan meeting. 
•	Defect Tracking in Test Track, JIRA and ensuring that their status is as per the process.
•	Domain and Product - knowledge transfer within team. 
•	Participated in daily, weekly and monthly status reports generation.

projects.title: QCOM
projects.description:
Project Title	: QCOM  
Client		: Queensland, Victoria, South Australia and Tasmania.
Software used	: Windows.
Role		: Senior Test Engineer.

Project Description: QCOM is the serial based protocol designed for low Bandwidth LANs. It provide Multi-game support up to 65535 games, Bet Type meter monitoring, Player Choice meter monitoring, Note Acceptor version and status monitoring, PID and PID version control, Hot switching of game variations and Stand Alone progressives. 

Roles and Responsibilities:
•	Understanding client requirements for the application under test and preparation of clarification document (SRS).
•	Involved in Scrum and Sprint Plan meeting. 
•	Prepared test scenarios from requirements and QCOM technical standard spec.
•	Designed & executed test cases in Q Test.
•	Defect Tracking in JIRA and ensuring that their status is as per the process.
•	Domain and Product - knowledge transfer within team.
•	Performed Sanity, functional testing, Regression Testing and Ad-hoc testing. 
•	Participated in daily, weekly and monthly status reports generation.

projects.title: Quebec
projects.description:
Project Title	: Quebec
Client		: USA.
Software used	: C, Linux and G2S Protocol.
Role		: Associate Test Engineer.

Project Description: Loto-Quebec is a Quebec government corporation whose mandate is to operate games of chance in the province in an orderly and measured way. We have provided operating systems which having a capabilities to change the components through Ethernet protocol as per Loto-Quebec standard. Venders can easily upgrade the OS and game from remote location through Host for more than one EGM thus by reducing the effort and time consumption of doing it manually.

Roles and Responsibilities:
•	Written script in XML format for G2S protocol to simulate field set up.
•	Understanding client requirements for the application under test and preparation of clarification document (SRS).
•	Domain and Product - knowledge transfer within team.
•	Involved in Scrum and Sprint Plan meeting. 
•	Prepared test scenarios from requirements and G2S spec.
•	Designed & executed test cases in Silk Central.
•	Defect Tracking in Test Track and ensuring that their status is as per the process.
•	Sanity testing was performed for each and every build.
•	Performed functional testing, Regression Testing and Ad-hoc testing. 
•	Participated in daily, weekly and monthly status reports generation.
•	Performed memory leak testing.

projects.title: Sinatra 2.0
projects.description:
Project Description:  
Fiery digital printing solution and workflow software was new product by EFI. The aim was sophisticated color management, including media calibration and output optimization of wide-format device. The result is superior color accuracy and increased overall productivity.

Roles & Responsibilities:
•	Smoke Testing and Regression testing.
•	Feature testing of Fiery on Ricoh Printing Engines.
•	Execution of test cases. Creation and change of test cases for new functionalities
•	Logging defects in Jira.

projects.title: Take ‘n Play
projects.description:
Project Title	: Take ‘n Play 
Client		: South Africa, Panama, Columbia Casino Market.
Software used	: Android, SQL.
Role		: Trainee.

Project Description:  Smoking Restrictions in Gaming Area in South Africa and other markets has resulted in significant revenue loss for Casinos. Solution to this problem is Take ‘N Play. The purpose of this solution is to allow Casinos to support Game Play on remote mobile devices that are allowed to be carried in smoking areas.
It is Peer to Peer remote game play between Mobile Device and Bally Gaming Machines. Gaming Machine shall be paired with Mobile Device and shall use Bally EGM as Streaming Host and Remote Device as Streaming Client. 

Roles and Responsibilities:
•	Install and configure the TNP server, Database, WebApp on TNP server machine.
•	Install and configure the Client app on Android based client.
•	Perform Integration testing, Unit Testing, Ad-hoc Testing and Smoke Testing with all components.
•	Execute basic queries to access the database on RCG server.
•	Defect Tracking in Test Track and ensuring that their status is as per the process.
•	Domain and Product - knowledge transfer within team.
•	Sanity testing was performed for each and every build.
•	Participated in Daily Status Report.

projects.title: Wall Street Winners
projects.description:
Project Title	: Wall Street Winners
Client		: USA
Software used	: C, Linux, Windows server 8, Microsoft SQL server.
Role		: Graduate Engineer Trainee.

Project Description:  
A new gaming concept, “shared jackpot”. WSW (Wall Street Winners) is the internal project name for Bally Technologies’ first “shared jackpot” game. Shares will be issued as a “prize saver” ticket from the EGM ticket printer. These tickets will have a distinctive barcode to distinguish it from cash, jackpot, promotional or any other type of ticket. To ensure fairness to players that are unable or unwilling to return to the property after the jackpot is triggered, the player has the option to select the shares or an immediate win to the credit meter. 

Roles and Responsibilities:
•	Worked on the Shared jackpot ticket database in BEPS (Bally Enterprise progressive system).
•	Understanding client requirements for the application under test and preparation of clarification document (SRS).
•	Prepared test scenarios from requirements and SAS spec.
•	Designed & executed test cases in Silk Central.
•	Defect Tracking in Test Track and ensuring that their status is as per the process.
•	Sanity testing was performed for each and every build.
•	Performed functional testing, Regression Testing and Ad-hoc testing. 
•	Participated in daily, weekly and monthly status reports generation.
•	Performed memory leak testing.
